newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Commission postpones vote on BSE sheep tissue ban.
newsitem.headline: Commission postpones vote on BSE sheep tissue ban.

text.p: The European Commission postponed a vote on Friday by senior member state veterinary officials on a revised proposal to remove suspect tissue from sheep, goats and cattle, a Commission official said.
The official, speaking after a nine-hours meeting, said that the Standing Veterinary Committee would on Monday re-examine the proposal aimed at curbing the spread of mad cow disease.
The Commission decided to delay a vote after 10 member states expressed opposition, saying that removal of the tissue was economically unjustified in view of the negligeable risk involved.
A previous Commission proposal to remove sheep brains, spleens and spinal cords from human and animal food was rejected.
